intro: Brassica oleracea subvar. rubra-minor, commonly known as red cabbage, is a biennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, compact heads of tightly packed, deep red leaves that are rich in anthocyanins. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, yellow flowers in the spring. Its leaves are edible and commonly used in cooking, while the plant is also valued for its nutritional content and medicinal properties. It thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
